metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5873 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the __ns_get_path function in fs/nsfs.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11. Due to a race condition when accessing files, a Use After Free condition can occur. This also affects all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-lowlatency - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-121.145

linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-121.145').
